basic.description: This course provides a foundational understanding of the social and psychological basis to the notion of "at risk" and explores various approaches to effect change in children including cognitive behavioural theory, motivational interviewing, collaborative problem solving, and restorative practice. The impact of socioeconomic status, family dynamics, social factors, and biological markers will be examined.
basic.subject: EDST
basic.title: Understanding At-Risk Children (PJ)
